meanings.sent1: The chalked sidewalk was colorful and bright.
meanings.sent2: The chalked drawings on the board were easy to erase.
meanings.sent3: The chalked hopscotch game made the children laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her chalked smile was as temporary as the rain.
meanings.sent5: The chalked lines stood out against the dark pavement.

meanings.sent1: The chalked lines on the field marked the boundaries clearly.
meanings.sent2: The chalked numbers on the blackboard were fading.
meanings.sent3: The chalked equations seemed to dance on the board.
meanings.sent4: His chalked words echoed in the empty classroom.
meanings.sent5: The chalked letters were smudged from constant use.

meanings.definition: To attribute something to a particular cause or reason.
meanings.sent1: She chalked her success up to hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: The detective chalked the crime to a professional thief.
meanings.sent3: He chalked his forgetfulness to a busy schedule.
meanings.sent4: The team captain chalked the victory up to teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The scientist chalked the discovery to years of research.
